sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Ireland is set to become the first country in the world to impose warning labels on alcoholic drinks and explain how dangerous they are to your health if you drink them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The law is due to be introduced in 2026 and there's now a push for the entire European Union to follow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We believe that all consumers should have the facts about alcohol included and details of risks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We would also like the European Commission to publish a revision of the EU legislation as soon as possible. And European doctors, CPME, supports the right of national governments to take initiatives such as the Irish case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The packaging on alcoholic drinks will have to warn that alcohol can cause some cancers and liver disease, and it can be dangerous for pregnant women.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: That's prompted concern among alcohol producers across the continent who fear their sales will be affected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But at least one drinks industry body is not attacking the health message itself.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Instead, it's talking about the complexities of internal market coherence and even how the European region is defined by the World Health Organization.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We do not believe that the Irish legislation is a particularly useful or practical solution in terms of internal market coherence to harmonize at European level.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: What we need to differentiate very clearly is that usually the term Europe in such debates refers to the WHO European regions, which stretches from Lisbon to Vladivostok, includes Turkey and many of the Central Asian republics. Almost 1% of EU GDP is spent on alcoholic drinks. In 2021, EU householders spent 128 billion euros on them. The World Health Organization welcomes Ireland's move.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: So WHO collects data from all the countries and it's true that one million deaths is the aggregated number that covers 53 countries in the European region. So these three areas, pricing, availability, marketing restriction, have plenty of source of evidence that they do have an impact, they are cost-effective, and they are very important with a huge impact in reducing the mortality and also in reducing decreases in life expectancy, which are also linked to alcohol consumption.

sentences.sentence: The first global conference on sustainable livestock transformation

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: opened its doors on Monday in Rome for three days of discussions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The summit aims to engage in dialogues around innovation and pathways to efficiently produce healthier animal-based foods while reducing their environmental footprints.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: healthier animal-based foods while reducing their environmental footprints.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Sustainable livestock production promotes the long-term viabilities of agri-food systems, protects natural resources, improves economic resilience, and contributes to a more sustainable and resilient future. With global demand for animal food products expected to increase by 20% by 2050, meat, eggs and dairy products will play a crucial role globally to ensure food security and healthy sustainable diets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: At the same time, the conference also aims to develop the industry's efficiency, looking at initiatives that would meet the world's changing needs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We must first focus on improving the efficiencies of livestock system. This includes optimizing feed conversion, reduce feed waste, enhancing nutrients utilization, reducing the degradation of land and water resources, decreasing greenhouse gas emissions and mitigating environmental degradation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In addition, we must prioritize the adoption of climate-smart agricultures and livestock practices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The aim of the Rome conference is to raise awareness on the role sustainable livestock production plays in the world and to define priorities for mobilizing scientific, technical and financial resources.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Since March, Scotland's waters have been gripped by an unprecedented Category 4 marine heatwave, an unusual event which has caused mass marine mortalities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: For some of Scotland's salmon farms, the staggering four degree temperature increase has led to a heightened risk of sea lice infestations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A recent investigation uncovered alarming evidence on five farms where fish were observed covered in the invasive sea lice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Marine heat waves are becoming more frequent, which creates this optimal breeding reservoir for sea lice to rampantly reproduce.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And these are the things that eat the skin, the mucus, the blood of the salmon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And, you know, these can expel out into the wider environment in their millions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Sea lice, typically found in low densities in the wild, have become a growing concern.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: An exacerbating factor is the increasing sea temperature.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: 2022 was a record-breaking year with salmon deaths doubling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This year the outlook is even grimmer. An alarming 8.9 million fish have been reported as dead on Scottish salmon farms in 2023 already.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And while salmon farming was once seen as a potential solution to helping wild stocks replenish, sea lice are now making it a problem as they're spreading from the farms to wild salmon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Salmon farming was seen as a sort of salvation and then, of course, the complexities become more apparent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And right now, the numbers and size of wild salmon continue to drop.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's tragic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The salmon industry says it prioritizes the well-being of the fish and stresses the technologies and innovations it uses against the sea lice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But there are other threats that come from rising sea temperatures. Jellyfish thrive in warmer waters and they can both sting the salmon and block their gills. Across Europe and the world, rising sea temperatures in 2023 tested marine ecosystems and aquaculture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Any sudden big rise that gets beyond what the animals are used to can cause stress to the point where they will die.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: We could see mass mortality of aquaculture, whether they be fish or shellfish.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Salmon is one of the UK's top exports, but this year around a quarter of farmed salmon perished. And whilst innovative solutions are being explored, the global challenge of increasing sea temperatures will continue to affect both those who farm and fish and the marine life they oversee.
